DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to compare the clinical effect of PEEK housing vs. metal housing in terms of retention and patient satisfaction
DOC.brief_title: (PEEK) Housing Verses Metallic Housing of Ball and Socket Attachment on Retention of Mandibular Overdenture
DOC.criteria: 1. Patient should be free from any systemic disease that may interfere with dental implants placement and/or osseointegration e.g. uncontrolled diabetes, hypertension, blood diseases, bone diseases, smoking.etc. 2. Patients have completely edentulous upper and lower arches. 3. Patients have healthy mucosa free from any ulceration, inflammation or infections. 4. All patients are free from neuromuscular and temporomandibular joint disorders. 5. Selected patients have normal maxillomandibular relationship (Angle class I ridge classification) with adequate interarch space and normal tongue size. 1. Patients with limited manual dexterity. 2. Patients with Xerostomia, excessive salivation or pathological mucosal changes (e.g. Lichen planus, Leukoplakiaâ€¦etc.) 3. Pregnant females. 4. Un cooperative patients.
